tldr: In his anniversary address, Lord Rayleigh reflects on the significant losses of prominent scientists and the progress made in various fields of science. He discusses the importance of the Second Law of Thermodynamics and the influence of Lord Kelvin's work, as well as the challenges and benefits of scientific specialization. Rayleigh also addresses concerns about the arrangement of manuscripts, symbol usage in mathematics and physics, and the potential impact of highly specialized mathematics on general intellectual training.
